summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 between defense attorney Bruce Barket and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding concerns about client Nicholas Tartaglione and a leak of false information about him at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), following complaints about Jeffrey Epstein's death. It shows legal communication about an inmate's treatment and a press inquiry.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione, expressing concerns about a leak of false information regarding his client at the MCC and thanking the AUSA for checking on his client.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Bruce Barket's client who was reportedly questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC, as per a press inquiry.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a press inquiry about a possible attack on him at the MCC, which is the subject of the leaked false information regarding Nicholas Tartaglione.

persons.name: Tracy Connor
persons.context: Journalist from The Daily Beast who contacted Bruce Barket seeking comment on a story about Nicholas Tartaglione being questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the defense attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione, as evidenced by his advocacy regarding a leak and his meeting with Tartaglione.
Both were inmates at the MCC, and Tartaglione was reportedly questioned about a possible attack on Epstein.
Connor contacted Barket as a journalist seeking comment on a story involving his client, Nicholas Tartaglione.

events.title: Press Inquiry About Possible Epstein Attack
events.description: Tracy Connor contacts Bruce Barket about a story that his client, Nicholas Tartaglione, was questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC.

events.title: AUSA Response on Open Investigation
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney responds to Bruce Barket, stating the matter is an open investigation and information cannot be shared, while assuring no retaliation against his client.

events.title: Barket Thanks AUSA and Requests Urgent Call
events.description: Bruce Barket thanks the AUSA for checking on his client and swapping books, then later requests an urgent call regarding the situation.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: An email chain reveals a press inquiry about Nicholas Tartaglione being questioned regarding a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC in July 2019.
Defense attorney Bruce Barket raised concerns about a leak of false information regarding his client, Tartaglione, at the MCC.
An Assistant United States Attorney confirmed the matter was an open investigation and cautioned MCC staff against retaliating against Tartaglione.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal and media attention surrounding Epstein's incarceration and death at the MCC.
